intro: Erythroxylum coffeifolium, commonly known as the coffeeleaf mallow, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some areas for both horticultural and research purposes.
